agky.defHTML: A model for hadronization of non-resonant inelastic neutrino reactions used in GENIE. For invariant hadronic masses between 2.3 and 3.0 GeV/c2, the model transitions linearly to a GENIE-tuned version of PYTHIA, which is also used for the simulation of events at higher invariant masses.
agky.defLaTeX: A model for hadronization of non-resonant inelastic neutrino reactions used in \gls{genie}. At low invariant hadronic masses, typically less than 2.3\,GeV/c$^2$, it is a KNO-inspired empirical model anchored on several bubble chamber measurements of neutrino-induced shower characteristics. For invariant hadronic masses between 2.3 and 3.0\,GeV/c$^2$, the model transitions linearly to a \gls{genie}-tuned version of PYTHIA, which is also used for the simulation of events at higher invariant masses

cno.defHTML:
The CNO cycle (for carbon-nitrogen-oxygen) is one of the two known
sets of fusion reactions by which stars convert hydrogen to helium, the
other being the proton-proton chain reaction (pp-chain reaction). In the
CNO cycle, four protons fuse, using carbon, nitrogen, and oxygen
isotopes as catalysts, to produce one alpha particle, two positrons and
two electron neutrinos.

daqdr.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ front-end fragment that accepts data from the FER, emits trigger candidates produced from the input trigger primitives, and forwards the full data stream to the DAQ primary buffer.
daqdr.defLaTeX: The portion of the  \gls{daqfrag} that accepts data from the \gls{daqfer}, emits  trigger candidates produced from the input trigger primitives, and  forwards the full data stream to the \gls{daqbuf}

daqds.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ front-end fragment that accepts trigger commands and returns the corresponding data fragment. Not to be confused with data selection.
daqds.defLaTeX: The portion of the \gls{daqfrag}  that accepts \glspl{trigcommand} and returns the corresponding  \gls{datafrag}.  Not to be confused with \gls{daqdsn}

daqdsn.defHTML: The process of forming a trigger decision for selecting a subset of detector data for output by the DAQ from the content of the detector data itself. Not to be confused with data selector.
daqdsn.defLaTeX: The process of forming a trigger decision for selecting a subset of detector data for output by the \gls{daq} from the content of the detector data itself.  Not to be confused with \gls{daqds}

daqdss.defHTML: The subsystem of the DAQ responsible for forming a trigger decision based on a portion of the input data stream. The majority subset of the DAQ TS.
daqdss.defLaTeX: The subsystem of the \gls{daq} responsible for forming a trigger decision based on a portion of the input data stream.  The majority subset of the \gls{daqtrs}

daqdts.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ that provides for timing and synchronization to various detector systems.
daqdts.defLaTeX: The portion of the \gls{daq} that provides for timing and synchronization to various detector systems

daqeti.defHTML: Interface between MTLs and external source and sinks of relevant trigger information.
daqeti.defLaTeX: Interface between \glspl{mtl} and external source and sinks of relevant trigger information

daqfer.defHTML: The portion of a DAQ front-end fragment that accepts data from the detector electronics and provides it to the DAQ FEC.
daqfer.defLaTeX: The portion of a  \gls{daqfrag} that accepts data from the detector electronics and  provides it to the \gls{fec}

daqfrag.defHTML: The portion of one DAQ partition relating to a single DAQ FEC and corresponding to an integral number of detector units. See also data fragment.
daqfrag.defLaTeX: The portion of one  \gls{daqpart} relating to a single \gls{fec} and corresponding to an  integral number of \glspl{detunit}.  See also \gls{datafrag}

daqoob.defHTML: This component is responsible for dispatching a SNB dump command to all FERs in the far detector module.
daqoob.defLaTeX: This component is responsible for dispatching a \gls{snb} dump  command to all \glspl{daqfer} in the \gls{detmodule}

daqpart.defHTML: A cohesive and coherent collection of DAQ hardware and software working together to trigger and read out some portion of one detector module; it consists of an integral number of DAQ front-end fragments. Multiple DAQ partitions may operate simultaneously, but each instance operates independently.
daqpart.defLaTeX: A cohesive and coherent collection of \gls{daq} hardware and software working together to trigger and read out some portion of one detector module; it consists of an integral number of \glspl{daqfrag}. Multiple \gls{daq} partitions may operate simultaneously, but each instance operates independently

daqros.defHTML: The subsystem of the DAQ for accepting and buffering data input from detector electronics.
daqros.defLaTeX: The subsystem of the \gls{daq} for accepting and buffering data input from detector electronics

daqrou.defHTML: The basic component of the DAQ RO.

daqrun.defHTML: A period of time over which relevant data taking conditions and DAQ configuration are asserted to be unchanged. Multiple DAQ runs may occur simultaneously when multiple DAQ partitions are active. This term should not be confused with DUNE experiment or beam "runs" that typically span many DAQ runs.
daqrun.defLaTeX: A period of time over which relevant data taking conditions and \gls{daq} configuration are asserted to be unchanged.  Multiple \gls{daq} runs may occur simultaneously when multiple \glspl{daqpart} are active.  This term should not be confused with DUNE experiment or beam ``runs'' that typically span many \gls{daq} runs

daqrunnum.defHTML: A monotonically increasing count that uniquely and globally identifies a DAQ run.
daqrunnum.defLaTeX: A monotonically increasing count that uniquely and globally identifies a \gls{daqrun}

daqtrs.defHTML: The subsystem of the DAQ responsible for forming a trigger decision.
daqtrs.defLaTeX: The subsystem of the \gls{daq} responsible for forming a trigger decision

daqtss.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ that provides for timing and synchronization to various components.
daqtss.defLaTeX: The portion of the \gls{daq} that provides for timing and synchronization to various components

daqubi.defHTML: The process which provides read-only access to data residing in the upstream DAQ buffers to processes on the network.
daqubi.defLaTeX: The process which provides read-only access to data residing in the upstream \gls{daq} buffers to processes on the network

darkside.defHTML: a dual-phase argon TPC, developed for use in a search for direct evidence of dark matter.
darkside.defLaTeX: a dual-phase argon \gls{tpc}, developed for use in a search for direct evidence of dark matter

datadis.defHTML:
communicates between running processing jobs and the data delivery
systems. It provides file location information and basic bookkeeping on
file access and transfers.
datadis.defLaTeX: communicates between running processing jobs and the data delivery systems.  It provides file location information and basic bookkeeping on file access and transfers

datafrag.defHTML: A block of data read out from a single DAQ front-end fragment thatspan a contiguous period of time as requested by a trigger command.
datafrag.defLaTeX: A block of data read out from a single \gls{daqfrag} thatspan a contiguous period of time as requested by a \gls{trigcommand}

datalake.defHTML:
The not-yet-realized concept of a storage service with multiple
levels of quality of service in which the end user can access data
without knowing the data’s source location.
datalake.defLaTeX: The not-yet-realized concept of a storage service with multiple levels of quality of service in which the end user can access data without knowing the data's source location

datatier.defHTML:
Differing data types produced in a processing sequence, for example,
raw data, reconstructed, derived analysis sample, histograms.
datatier.defLaTeX: Differing data types produced in a processing sequence, for example, raw data, reconstructed, derived analysis sample, histograms

dayabay.defHTML: a neutrino-oscillation experiment in Daya Bay, China, designed to measure the mixing angle Θ13 using antineutrinos produced by the reactors of the Daya Bay and Ling Ao nuclear power plants.
dayabay.defLaTeX: a neutrino-oscillation experiment in Daya Bay, China, designed to measure the mixing angle $\Theta_{13}$  using antineutrinos produced by the reactors of the Daya Bay and Ling Ao nuclear power plants

dcache.defHTML: A distributed, highly scalable (multi-PB) storage system, usable as both a standalone system and as a high-speed frontend to a tape storage system (such as PNFS at Fermilab ).
dcache.defLaTeX: A distributed, highly scalable (multi-PB) storage system, usable as both a standalone system and as a high-speed frontend to a tape storage system (such as \gls{pnfs} at \gls{fnal} )

dcdb.defHTML: Database used by DUNE to track the history and testing of all parts of each far detector module.
dcdb.defLaTeX: Database used by DUNE to track the history and testing of all parts of each \gls{detmodule}

ddss.defHTML: The hardware system responsible for the safety of the detector, implemented either via a PLC or via custom hardware protections.
ddss.defLaTeX: The hardware system responsible for the safety of the detector, implemented either via a \gls{plc} or via custom hardware protections

detmodule.defHTML: The entire DUNE far detector design calls for segmentation into four modules, each with a total/fiducial mass in kt of approximately 17/10; in Phase I of LBNF/DUNE two modules will be constructed, FD-VD and FD-HD.
detmodule.defLaTeX: The entire DUNE far detector design calls for segmentation into  four modules,  each with a total/fiducial mass in kt of approximately 17/10; in Phase I of LBNF/DUNE two modules will be constructed, \gls{spvd} and \gls{sphd}

detunit.defHTML: A portion of a far detector module may be further partitioned into a number of similar parts. For example, the FD-HD TPC is made up of APA units (and other elements).
detunit.defLaTeX: A portion of a \gls{detmodule} may be further partitioned into a number of similar parts.   For example, the \gls{sphd} \gls{tpc} is made up of \gls{apa}  units (and other elements)

dirac.defHTML:
Computing workflow management designed for LHCb and now used by many
HEP experiments.
dirac.defLaTeX: Computing workflow management designed for LHCb and now used by many HEP experiments

dis.defHTML:
Refers to interaction between elementary particles and a nucleus in
an energy range where the interaction can be modeled as occurring
between constituent quarks of one nucleon and resulting in no bulk
recoil of the resulting nucleus.
dis.defLaTeX: Refers to interaction between  elementary particles and a nucleus in an energy range where the  interaction can be modeled as occurring between constituent quarks  of one nucleon and resulting in no bulk recoil of the resulting  nucleus

diskbuffer.defHTML: A secondary DAQ buffer holds a small subset of the full rate as selected by a trigger command. This buffer also marks the interface with the DUNE Offline.
diskbuffer.defLaTeX: A secondary  \gls{daq} buffer holds a small subset of the full rate as  selected by a \gls{trigcommand}.  This buffer also marks the interface with the DUNE Offline

dm.defHTML:
The term given to the unknown matter or force that explains
measurements of galaxy motion that are otherwise inconsistent with the
amount of mass associated with the observed amount of photon
production.
dm.defLaTeX: The term given to the unknown  matter or force that explains measurements of galaxy motion  that are otherwise inconsistent with the amount of mass associated  with the observed amount of photon production

dnl.defHTML: A commonly used measure of performance in ADCs. The DNL error is defined as the difference between an actual step width and the ideal value of one LSB.
dnl.defLaTeX: A commonly used measure of performance in \glspl{adc}. The DNL error is defined as the difference between an actual step width and the ideal value of one \gls{lsb}

docdb.defHTML: A computerized document management system developed and supported at Fermilab in which most LBNF and DUNE enterprise documents are managed (docs.dunescience.org); some documents are maintained in EDMS.
docdb.defLaTeX: A computerized document management system developed and supported at \gls{fnal} in which most \gls{lbnf-dune} documents are managed (docs.dunescience.org); some documents are maintained in \gls{edms}

doecd.defHTML:
The U.S. DOE’s Order 413.3B outlines a series of staged project
approvals, each of which is referred to as a critical decision (CD).
doecd.defLaTeX: The U.S. DOE's Order 413.3B outlines a series of staged project approvals, each of which is referred to as a critical decision (CD)

doma.defHTML: data organization, management, and access efforts through the HSF.
doma.defLaTeX: data organization, management, and access efforts through the \gls{hsf}

dp.defLaTeX: Distinguishes a \gls{lartpc} technology by the fact that it operates using argon in both gas and liquid phases; sometimes called double-phase

dpdfd.defHTML: Deputy Project Director for far detectors.
dpdfd.defLaTeX: Deputy Project Director for far detectors

dqm.defHTML: Analysis of the raw data to monitor the integrity of the data and the performance of the detectors and their electronics. This type of monitoring may be performed in real time, within the DAQ system, or in later stages of processing, using disk files as input.
dqm.defLaTeX: Analysis of the raw  data to monitor the integrity of the data and the performance of the  detectors and their electronics. This type of monitoring may be  performed in real time, within the \gls{daq} system, or in later  stages of processing, using disk files as input

dqmdb.defHTML: Database storing the results of data-quality monitoring.
dqmdb.defLaTeX: Database storing the results of data-quality monitoring

drift.defHTML: (1) refers to electron drift under the influence of an electric field in a TPC; (2) an excavated horizontal corridor (tunnel) in the underground areas at SURF.
drift.defLaTeX: (1) refers to electron drift under the influence of an electric field in a \gls{tpc}; (2) an excavated horizontal corridor (tunnel) in the underground areas at \gls{surf}

dsnb.defHTML:
The term describing the pervasive, constant flux of neutrinos due to
all past supernova neutrino bursts.
dsnb.defLaTeX: The  term describing the pervasive, constant flux of neutrinos due to all  past supernova neutrino bursts

dsp.defHTML: a single-phase DUNE far detector module.
dsp.defLaTeX: a single-phase DUNE far detector module

dss.defHTML: The system of rails suspended from the cryostat ceiling in a SP module used to support the APAs, CPAs, and the endwall FCs.
dss.defLaTeX: The system of rails suspended from the cryostat ceiling in a \gls{spmod} used to support the \gls{apa}s, \gls{cpa}s, and the \glspl{ewfc}

dumpbuffer.defHTML: This DAQ buffer accepts a high-rate data stream, in aggregate, from an associated portion of a far detector module sufficient to collect all data likely relevant to a potential SNB.
dumpbuffer.defLaTeX: This \gls{daq} buffer  accepts a high-rate data stream, in aggregate, from an associated  portion of a \gls{detmodule} sufficient to collect all data likely relevant to  a potential \gls{snb}

dune.defHTML:
A leading-edge, international experiment for neutrino science and
proton decay studies; refers to the entire international experiment and
collaboration.
dune.defLaTeX: A leading-edge, international experiment for neutrino science and proton decay studies; refers to the entire international experiment and collaboration

duneprism.defHTML:
a DUNE near detector system that consists of the hardware required to
move the ND-LAr and muon spectrometer subdetectors within the DUNE near
detector hall; it will allow the near detector to perform measurements
over a range of angles off-axis from the neutrino beam direction in
order to sample many different neutrino energy distributions.
duneprism.defLaTeX: a DUNE near detector system that consists of the hardware required to move the ND-LAr and muon spectrometer subdetectors within the DUNE near detector hall; it will allow the near detector to perform measurements over a range of angles off-axis from the neutrino beam direction in order to sample many different neutrino energy distributions

duneus.defHTML: Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment - United States; refers to the U.S. contribution to the DUNE experiment under the line-item LBNF/DUNE-US project.
duneus.defLaTeX: Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment - United States; refers to the U.S. contribution to the DUNE experiment under the line-item \gls{usproj} project

e4nu.defHTML:
A collaboration dedicated to using JLab’s electron-scattering data to
deliver improved neutrino-nucleus cross sections.
e4nu.defLaTeX: A collaboration dedicated to using JLab's electron-scattering data to deliver improved neutrino-nucleus cross sections

eb.defHTML: A software agent that executes trigger commands for one far detector module by reading out the requested data.
eb.defLaTeX: A software agent that executes \glspl{trigcommand}  for one  \gls{detmodule} by reading out the requested data

ecal.defHTML: A detector component that measures energy deposition of traversing particles (in the DUNE near detector design).
ecal.defLaTeX: A detector  component that measures energy deposition of traversing particles (in the \gls{dune} near detector design)

echain.defHTML: mechanical machine elements used to carry and guide power to moving parts of machines or structures, as required for DUNE-PRISM to carry power, data, and utilities to and from each movable near detector component at any arbitrary position along its travel path.
echain.defLaTeX: mechanical machine elements used to carry and guide power to moving parts of machines or structures, as required for \gls{duneprism} to carry power, data, and utilities to and from each movable near detector component at any arbitrary position along its travel path

edms.defHTML: A computerized document management system developed and supported at the CERN in which some DUNE project and collaboration documents, drawings and engineering models are managed.
edms.defLaTeX: A computerized document management system developed and supported at the \gls{cern} in which some \gls{dune} project and collaboration documents, drawings and engineering models are managed

eelaser.defHTML: a laser in which light is emitted from the edge of the substrate.
eelaser.defLaTeX: a laser in which  light is emitted from the edge of the substrate

efig.defHTML: The body that provides a means to coordinate and discuss issues related to the interfaces within and between the facility and the DUNE detectors at both the Fermilab and SURF sites.
efig.defLaTeX: The body that provides a means to coordinate and discuss issues related to the interfaces within and between the facility and the DUNE detectors at both the \gls{fnal} and \gls{surf} sites

ehn1.defHTML: Location at CERN of the NP02 and NP04 areas used for the ProtoDUNEs and for other test and prototyping activities for DUNE.
ehn1.defLaTeX: Location at \gls{cern} of the \gls{np02} and \gls{np04} areas used for the \glspl{protodune} and for other test and prototyping activities for DUNE

elife.defHTML:
The attachment of electrons drifting through liquid argon to impurity
molecules such as oxygen or water is parameterized by an exponential as
a function of time with a time constant called the electron lifetime.
elife.defLaTeX: The attachment of electrons drifting through liquid argon to impurity molecules such as oxygen or water is parameterized by an exponential as a function of time with a time constant called the electron lifetime

emi.defHTML:
Disturbance generated by an external source that affects an
electrical circuit by electromagnetic induction, electrostatic coupling,
or conduction.
emi.defLaTeX: Disturbance generated by an external source that affects an electrical circuit by electromagnetic induction, electrostatic coupling, or conduction

enc.defHTML: The equivalent noise charge is the input charge that corresponds to a S/N = 1.
enc.defLaTeX: The equivalent noise charge is the input charge that corresponds to a \gls{s/n}$=1$

enob.defHTML: The effective number of bits is a measure of the dynamic range of an ADC and its associated circuitry. The resolution of an ADC is specified by the number of bits used to represent the analog value, in principle giving 2N signal levels for an N-bit signal. However, all real ADC circuits introduce noise and distortion. ENOB specifies the resolution of an ideal ADC circuit that would have the same resolution as the circuit under consideration.
enob.defLaTeX: The effective number of bits is a measure of the dynamic range of an \gls{adc} and its associated circuitry. The resolution of an \gls{adc} is specified by the number of bits used to represent the analog value, in principle giving 2N signal levels for an N-bit signal. However, all real \gls{adc} circuits introduce noise and distortion. ENOB specifies the resolution of an ideal \gls{adc} circuit that would have the same resolution as the circuit under consideration

enstore.defHTML: A mass storage system developed by Fermilab that provides distributed access and management of data stored on tapes.
enstore.defLaTeX: A mass storage system developed by \gls{fnal} that provides distributed access and management of data stored on tapes

eos.defHTML: The XRootD-based distributed file system developed by CERN.
eos.defLaTeX: The XRootD-based distributed file system developed by CERN

es.defHTML:
Events in which a neutrinoelastically scatters off of another
particle.
es.defLaTeX: Events in which a neutrinoelastically scatters off of another particle

esh.defHTML:
A discipline and specialty that studies and implements practical
aspects of environmental protection and safety at work.
esh.defLaTeX: A discipline and specialty that studies and implements practical aspects of environmental protection and safety at work

espp.defHTML: Thecornerstone of Europe’sdecision-making process for the long-term future of thefield. Mandated by the CERN Council, it is formed through a broadconsultation of the grass-roots particle physics community, itactively solicits the opinions of physicists from around the world,and it is developed in close coordination with similar processes inthe USA and Japan in order to ensure coordination between regions andoptimal use of resources globally.
espp.defLaTeX: Thecornerstone of Europe'sdecision-making process for the long-term future of thefield. Mandated by the \gls{cern} Council, it is formed through a broadconsultation of the grass-roots particle physics community, itactively solicits the opinions of physicists from around the world,and it is developed in close coordination with similar processes inthe USA and Japan in order to ensure coordination between regions andoptimal use of resources globally

etf.defHTML: WLCG testing middleware that runs grid jobs that actively test distributed sites’ services and capabilities, and reports back to monitoring services.
etf.defLaTeX: \gls{wlcg} testing middleware that runs grid jobs that actively test distributed sites' services and capabilities,  and reports back to monitoring services

etl.defHTML: Trigger processing that consumes far detector module level trigger notification information and other global sources of trigger input and emits trigger command information back to the MTLs.
etl.defLaTeX: Trigger processing  that consumes \gls{detmodule} level \gls{trignote} information  and other global sources of trigger input and emits  \gls{trigcommand} information back to the \glspl{mtl}

evms.defHTML:
Earned Value Management is a systematic approach to the integration
and measurement of cost, schedule, and technical (scope) accomplishments
on a project or task. It provides both the government and contractors
the ability to examine detailed schedule information, critical program
and technical milestones, and cost data (text from the US DOE); the EVMS
is a system that implements this approach.
evms.defLaTeX: Earned Value Management is a systematic approach to the integration and measurement of cost, schedule, and technical (scope) accomplishments on a project or task. It provides both the government and contractors the ability to examine detailed schedule information, critical program and technical milestones, and cost data (text from the US DOE); the EVMS is a system that implements this approach

ewfc.defHTML: The vertical portions of the field cage near the end walls.
ewfc.defLaTeX: The vertical portions of the \gls{fc} near the end walls

exb.defHTML: The highest level DUNE decision-making body for the collaboration; members include the spokespersons, collaboration IB chair, TCs, resource coordinator, computing coordinator, physics coordinators, Phase II coordinators, and consortium leaders.
exb.defLaTeX: The highest level DUNE  decision-making body for the collaboration; members include the spokespersons,   collaboration \gls{ib} chair,  \glspl{tcoord},  resource coordinator,  computing coordinator,  physics coordinators,  Phase II coordinators,  and consortium leaders

exposure.defHTML:
The integrated detector fiducial mass times beam intensity; it is
proportional to the number of interactions and is used to normalize
cross sections in a data sample.
exposure.defLaTeX: The integrated detector fiducial mass times beam intensity; it is proportional to the number of interactions and is used to normalize cross sections in a data sample

externtrigger.defHTML: Information provided to the MTL about events external to a far detector module so that it may be considered in forming trigger commands.
externtrigger.defLaTeX: Information  provided to the \gls{mtl} about events external to a  \gls{detmodule} so that it may be considered in forming  \glspl{trigcommand}

faq.defHTML:
A software system for collecting and answering the most common
questions about an activity.
faq.defLaTeX: A software system for collecting and answering the most common questions about an activity

fbk.defHTML:
FBK is a research non-profit entity in Trento, Italy that partners in
the development of technology with applications in various fields
including High Energy Physics.
fbk.defLaTeX: FBK is a research non-profit entity in Trento, Italy that partners in the development of technology with applications in various fields including High Energy Physics

fc.defHTML: The component of a LArTPC that contains and shapes the applied E field.
fc.defLaTeX: The component of a \gls{lartpc} that contains and shapes the applied \efield

fcss.defHTML: The support system suspended from the cryostat ceiling in the FD-VD Module 0 used to support the field cage.
fcss.defLaTeX: The support system suspended from the cryostat ceiling in the \gls{vdmod0} used to support the \gls{fc}

fd.defHTML: The 70 kt total (40 fiducial) mass LArTPC DUNE detector, composed of four 17 kt total (10 kt fiducial) mass modules, to be installed at the far site at SURF in Lead, SD, USA.
fd.defLaTeX: The \SI{70}{kt} total (40 fiducial) mass \gls{lartpc} DUNE detector, composed of four 17 kt total (10 kt fiducial) mass modules,  to be installed at the far site at \gls{surf} in  Lead, SD, USA

fdr.defHTML:
Depending on context, either "final design report," a formal project
document that describes the experiment at a final level, or "final
design review," a formal review of the final design of the experiment or
of a component.
fdr.defLaTeX: Depending on context, either ``final design report,'' a formal project document  that describes the experiment at a final level, or ``final design review,'' a formal review of the final design of the experiment or of a component

fe.defHTML: The front-end refers to a point that is "upstream" of the data flow for a particular subsystem. For example the FD-HD front-end electronics is where the cold electronics meet the sense wires of the TPC and the front-end DAQ is where the DAQ meets the output of the electronics.
fe.defLaTeX: The front-end refers to a point that is  ``upstream'' of the data flow for a particular subsystem. For example the \gls{sphd} front-end electronics is where the cold electronics  meet the sense wires of the TPC and the front-end \gls{daq} is where the \gls{daq} meets the output of the electronics

fea.defHTML:
Simulation of a physical phenomenon using the numerical technique
called Finite Element Method (FEM), a numerical method for solving
problems of engineering and mathematical physics.
fea.defLaTeX: Simulation of a physical phenomenon using the numerical technique called Finite Element Method (FEM), a numerical method for solving problems of engineering and mathematical physics

fec.defHTML: The portion of one DAQ partition that hosts the DDR, DAQ primary buffer and data selector. It hosts the FER and corresponding portion of the DAQ primary buffer.
fec.defLaTeX: The portion of one  \gls{daqpart} that hosts the \gls{daqdr}, \gls{daqbuf} and  \gls{daqds}.  It hosts the \gls{daqfer} and corresponding portion of the \gls{daqbuf}

felix.defHTML: A high-throughput interface between FE and trigger electronics and the standard PCIe computer bus.
felix.defLaTeX: A  high-throughput interface between \gls{fe} and trigger electronics  and the standard PCIe computer bus

femb.defHTML: Refers to a unit of the SP CE that contains the FE amplifier and ADC ASICs covering 128 channels.
femb.defLaTeX: Refers to a unit of  the \gls{sp} \gls{ce} that contains the \gls{fe} amplifier  and \gls{adc} \glspl{asic} covering 128 channels

ferry.defHTML: a central database that keeps track of all scientific computing users at Fermilab, the experiments and groups of which they are members, and the various capabilities they are allowed.
ferry.defLaTeX: a central database that keeps track of all scientific computing users at \gls{fnal}, the experiments and groups of which they are members, and the various capabilities they are allowed

feshm.defHTML: The document that contains Fermilab ’s policies and procedures designed to manage environment, safety, and health in all its programs.
feshm.defLaTeX: The document that contains \gls{fnal} 's policies and procedures designed to manage environment, safety, and health in all its programs
feshm.term: Fermilab Environment, Safety and Health Manual
feshm.termHTML: Fermilab Environment, Safety and Health Manual

ffdg.defHTML: A joint partnership that manages and operates Fermilab as of January 2025 on behalf of the DOE; the FFDG team is comprised of four entities: the University of Chicago (UChicago), Universities Research Association, Inc. (URA), Amentum Environment & Energy, Inc. (Amentum), and Longenecker & Associates (L&A).
ffdg.defLaTeX: A joint partnership that manages and operates \gls{fnal} as of January 2025 on behalf of the \gls{doe}; the FFDG team is comprised of four entities: the University of Chicago (UChicago), Universities Research Association, Inc. (URA), Amentum Environment \& Energy, Inc. (Amentum), and Longenecker \& Associates (L\&A)

fft.defHTML:
An algorithm that calculates the frequency components of a
time-domain waveform in a computationally efficient manner.
fft.defLaTeX: An algorithm that calculates the frequency components of a time-domain waveform in a computationally efficient manner

fhicl.defHTML:
Fermilab Hierarchical Configuration Language; a standard
configuration language for the storage, communication, and manipulation
of scientific parameter sets.
fhicl.defLaTeX: Fermilab Hierarchical Configuration Language; a standard configuration language for the storage, communication, and manipulation of scientific parameter sets

fife.defHTML: Fermilab computing infrastructure for IF Experiments.

fifemon.defHTML: Comprehensive suite of job and storage monitoring information available for most Fermilab experiments, including DUNE.
fifemon.defLaTeX: Comprehensive suite of job and storage monitoring information available for most \gls{fnal} experiments, including DUNE

firus.defHTML: Facility incident reporting systems, one at Fermilab and at SURF, that monitors and reports the status of various fire, security and utility sensors.
firus.defLaTeX: Facility incident reporting systems, one at \gls{fnal} and at \gls{surf}, that monitors and reports the status of various fire, security and utility sensors

fls.defHTML: Fire and life safety; systems designed with CF to meet building/safety code compliance for safe facilities at SURF and at Fermilab.
fls.defLaTeX: Fire and life safety; systems designed with \gls{cf} to meet building/safety code compliance for safe facilities at \gls{surf} and at \gls{fnal}

fmc.defHTML: Boards holding FPGAs and other integrated circuitry that attach to a motherboard.
fmc.defLaTeX: Boards holding \glspl{fpga} and other integrated circuitry that attach to a motherboard

fnal.defHTML: U.S. national laboratory in Batavia, IL. It is the laboratory that hosts LBNF and DUNE, and serves as the experiment’s near site.

The \gls{ecal} and detector region are embedded in a \SI{0.6}{T} magnetic field created by a \SI{4.86}{m} diameter superconducting coil and a \SI{475}{tonne} iron yoke

lartpc.defLaTeX: A \gls{tpc} filled with liquid argon;the basis for the \gls{dune} \gls{fd} modules

las.defHTML: In the DP technology, a LEM and its corresponding anode are mounted together in a module called a LEM-anode sandwich.

lbl.defHTML: Refers to the distance between the neutrino source and the FD. It can also refer to the distance between the near and far detectors. The "long" designation is an approximate and relative distinction. For DUNE, this distance (between Fermilab and SURF) is approximately 1300 km.
lbl.defLaTeX: Refers to the distance between the  neutrino source  and the \gls{fd}.  It can also refer to the distance between the near and far detectors.  The ``long'' designation is an approximate and relative distinction. For DUNE, this distance  (between \gls{fnal} and \gls{surf}) is approximately \SI{1300}{km}

lbls.defHTML:
Auxiliary calibration system providing an independent location
measurement of the ionization laser beams direction.
lbls.defLaTeX: Auxiliary calibration system providing an independent location measurement of the ionization laser beams direction

lbnc.defHTML: The committee, composed of internationally prominent scientists with relevant expertise, charged by the Fermilab director to review the scientific, technical, and managerial progress, plans and decisions associated with DUNE.
lbnc.defLaTeX: The committee, composed of internationally prominent scientists with relevant expertise, charged by the \gls{fnal} director to review the scientific, technical, and managerial progress, plans and decisions associated with \gls{dune}

lbne.defHTML: Long Baseline Neutrino Experiment; (1) a terminated U.S. experiment that was reformulated in 2014 under the auspices of the new DUNE collaboration, an internationally coordinated and internationally funded program, with Fermilab as host; and (2) the former incarnation of LBNF/DUNE-US.

lbnf.defHTML: Long-Baseline Neutrino Facility; refers to the facilities that support the experiment, including in-kind contributions under the line-item project. The portion of LBNF/DUNE-US responsible for developing the neutrino beam, the far site cryostats, and far and near site cryogenics systems, and the conventional facilities, including the excavations.
lbnf.defLaTeX: Long-Baseline Neutrino Facility; refers to the facilities that support the experiment, including in-kind contributions under the line-item project. The portion of \gls{usproj} responsible for developing the neutrino beam, the far site cryostats,  and far and near site cryogenics systems, and the conventional facilities, including the excavations

lbnf-dune.defHTML: Long-Baseline Neutrino Facility/Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment; refers to the overall enterprise or program including LBNF/DUNE-US, participating international projects, and the DUNE experiment and collaboration.
lbnf-dune.defLaTeX: Long-Baseline Neutrino Facility/Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment; refers to the overall enterprise or program including \gls{usproj}, participating international projects, and the \gls{dune} experiment and collaboration

lbnfspac.defHTML: A committee charged by the host laboratory director to provide expert, independent advice on significant issues and strategies related to LBNF/DUNE-US project organization, management, and risks.

lbnfspac.termHTML: LBNF / DUNE-US Strategic Project Advisory Committee

lbnl.defHTML: US national laboratory in Berkeley, CA.

lbno.defHTML:
A terminated European project that, during its six-year duration,
assessed the feasibility of a next-generation deep underground neutrino
observatory in Europe).
lbno.defLaTeX: A terminated European project that, during its six-year duration, assessed the feasibility of a next-generation deep underground neutrino observatory in Europe)

ldm.defHTML:
Refers to dark matter particles with mass values much lower than the
electroweak scale, specifically below the 1 GeV level.
ldm.defLaTeX: Refers to dark matter particles with mass values much lower than the electroweak scale, specifically below the 1~GeV level

ldmx.defHTML: The LDMX detector concept consists of a small precision tracker, and electromagnetic and hadronic calorimeters, all with near 2π azimuthal acceptance from the forward beam axis out to  ∼ 40∘ angle. This detector would be capable of measuring correlations among electrons, pions, protons, and neutrons in electron-nucleus scattering at exactly the energies relevant for DUNE physics.
ldmx.defLaTeX: The LDMX detector concept consists of a small precision tracker, and electromagnetic and hadronic calorimeters, all with near $2\pi$ azimuthal acceptance from the forward beam axis out to $\sim40^\circ$ angle. This detector would be capable of measuring correlations among electrons, pions, protons, and neutrons in electron-nucleus scattering at exactly the energies relevant for DUNE physics

ldo.defHTML: A low-dropout or LDO regulator is a DC linear voltage regulator that can regulate the output voltage even when the supply voltage is very close to the output voltage.
ldo.defLaTeX: A low-dropout or LDO regulator is a \gls{dc} linear voltage regulator that can regulate the output voltage even when the supply voltage is very close to the output voltage

lem.defLaTeX: A micro-pattern detector suitable for use in ultra-pure argon vapor; LEMs consist of copper-clad PCB boards with sub-millimeter-size holes through which electrons undergo amplification

lhcb.defHTML: LHC experiment dedicated to forward physics.
lhcb.defLaTeX: LHC experiment dedicated to forward physics

lng.defHTML: Pertaining to natural gas in its liquid phase.
lng.defLaTeX: Pertaining to natural gas in its liquid phase

lro.defHTML: The system for detecting scintillation photons in a LArTPC detector module.
lro.defLaTeX: The system for detecting  scintillation photons in a \gls{lartpc} detector module

lsb.defHTML: The bit with the lowest numerical value in a binary number.
lsb.defLaTeX: The bit with the lowest numerical value in a binary number

lsnd.defHTML:
A scintillation detector and associated experiment located at Los
Alamos National Laboratory.
lsnd.defLaTeX: A scintillation detector and associated experiment located at Los Alamos National Laboratory

8.4 m telescope with 3.2G-pixel camera that will start taking data in
2023.

lux.defLaTeX: Large Underground Xenon (LUX) dark matter detector at \gls{surf}

lxplus.defHTML: The interactive logon service to Linux for all CERN users.
lxplus.defLaTeX: The interactive logon service to Linux for all \gls{cern} users

madx.defLaTeX: framework that provides the de facto standard scripting language to describe particle accelerators, simulate beam dynamics, and optimize beam optics at \gls{cern}

marley.termHTML: Model of Argon Reaction Low Energy Yields

Refers to a method of numerical integration that entails the
statistical sampling of the integrand function. Forms the basis for some
types of detector and physics simulations.
mc.defLaTeX: Refers to a method of numerical  integration that entails the statistical sampling of the integrand  function.  Forms the basis for some types of detector and physics simulations

mcr.defLaTeX: Space at the \gls{fd} site for cyber infrastructure

mec.defHTML:
An nuclear effect wherein pairs or larger groups of nucleons within a
nucleus are bound together through the exchange of pions or other
mesons. Neutrinos and other particles can scatter from these correlated
pairs.
mec.defLaTeX: An nuclear effect wherein pairs or larger groups of nucleons within a nucleus are bound together through the exchange of pions or other mesons. Neutrinos and other particles can scatter from these correlated pairs

Metadata Catalog, a modern replacement for the file description

A fixed but mutable collection of files defined by queries to the
data catalog.

mh.defHTML: Describes the separation between the mass squared differences related to the solar and atmospheric neutrino problems (also written as MO).
mh.defLaTeX: Describes the separation  between the mass squared differences related to the solar and  atmospheric neutrino problems (also written as \gls{mo})

mi.defHTML: An accelerator at Fermilab that provides a beam of high-energy protons to the the LBNF/DUNE-US beamline.

microboone.defHTML: A LArTPC neutrino oscillation experiment at Fermilab.

Refers to a particle traversing some medium such that the particle’s

module.defHTML:
Many aspects of the DUNE far and near detectors are modular, so
"module" must be understood in context. It may refer to one of the four
far detector modules, distinct portions of a subdetector as in a "field
cage module," a software or electronics module, e.g., a separate
framework plug-in, and so on.
module.defLaTeX: Many aspects of the DUNE far and near detectors are modular, so ``module'' must be understood in context.  It may refer to one of the four far detector modules,  distinct portions of a subdetector as in a ``field cage module,'' a software or electronics module,  e.g., a separate framework plug-in,  and so on

monit.defHTML: a suite of tools using open source technology used in the monitoring of the CERN IT data center and WLCG infrastructure..

mosi.defHTML: The Master Out Slave In is a logicsignal on the SPI bus on which the data from the master is transmitted.

mou.defHTML: A project management methodology that LBNF/DUNE-US uses to document agreement,s, e.g., between Fermilab and the Project, for how Fermilab will support the Project. More generally, a document summarizing an agreement between two or more parties.
mou.defLaTeX: A project management methodology that  \gls{usproj} uses to document agreement,s,  e.g., between \gls{fnal} and the Project, for how \gls{fnal}  will support the Project. More generally, a document  summarizing an agreement between two or more parties

mppc.defHTML: 6 mm×6 mm Multi-Pixel Photon Counters produced by Hamamatsu Photonics K.K.

A query language which supports queries of the data catalog,

subtraction.

Experiment sited in the Kamioka-mine, Hida-city, Gifu, Japan that
uses a large water Cherenkov detector to study neutrino properties
through the observation of solar neutrinos, atmospheric neutrinos and
man-made neutrinos.
sk.defLaTeX: Experiment sited in the Kamioka-mine, Hida-city, Gifu, Japan that uses a large water Cherenkov detector to study neutrino properties through the observation of solar neutrinos, atmospheric neutrinos and man-made neutrinos

ska.defHTML:
International radio telescope array planned to start data-taking in
2027.
ska.defLaTeX: International radio telescope array planned to start data-taking in 2027

slac.defHTML: US national laboratory in Menlo Park, CA.
slac.defLaTeX: US national laboratory in Menlo Park, CA

sls.defHTML: A system residing at the DUNE far detector site that provides information, possibly predictive, indicating periods of time when neutrinos are being produced by the Fermilab Main Injector beam spills.
sls.defLaTeX: A system residing at  the DUNE far detector site that provides information, possibly  predictive, indicating periods of time when neutrinos are being  produced by the \gls{fnal} Main Injector beam spills

sm.defHTML:
Refers to a theory describing the interaction of elementary
particles.
sm.defLaTeX: Refers to a theory describing  the interaction of elementary particles

sma.defHTML:
Connector interface for coaxial cableswith a screw-type coupling
mechanism.
sma.defLaTeX: Connector interface for coaxial cableswith a screw-type coupling mechanism

sme.defHTML: an effective field theory that contains the SM, general relativity, and all possible operators that break Lorentz symmetry (Wikipedia).
sme.defLaTeX: an effective field theory that contains the \gls{sm}, general relativity, and all possible operators that break Lorentz symmetry (Wikipedia)

sn.defHTML: Event that occurs upon the death of certain types of stars.
sn.defLaTeX: Event that occurs upon the death of certain types of stars

snb.defHTML:
A prompt increase in the flux of low-energy neutrinos emitted in the
first few seconds of a core-collapse supernova. It can also refer to a
trigger command type that may be due to this phenomenon, or detector
conditions that mimic its interaction signature.
snb.defLaTeX: A prompt  increase in the flux of low-energy neutrinos emitted in the first few seconds of a core-collapse supernova.  It can also refer to a trigger command type that may be due to this phenomenon,  or detector conditions that mimic its interaction signature

snble.defHTML: Supernova neutrino burst and low-energy physics program.
snble.defLaTeX: Supernova neutrino burst and low-energy physics program
snble.term: supernova neutrino burst and low  energy
snble.termHTML: supernova neutrino burst and low energy

sndr.defHTML: Also known as SINAD. Ratio of the RMS signal amplitude to the mean value of the root-sum-square of all other spectral components, including harmonics, but excluding DC levels. It is a good indication of the overall dynamic performance of an ADC because it includes all components which make up noise and distortion.
sndr.defLaTeX: Also known as SINAD. Ratio of the \gls{rms} signal amplitude to the mean value of the root-sum-square of all other spectral components, including harmonics, but excluding \gls{dc} levels. It is a good indication of the overall dynamic performance of an \gls{adc} because it includes all components which make up noise and distortion
sndr.term: signal to noise and distortion ratio
sndr.termHTML: signal to noise and distortion ratio

snews.defHTML: A global supernova neutrino burst trigger formed by a coincidence of SNB triggers collected from participating experiments.
snews.defLaTeX: A global  supernova neutrino burst trigger formed by a coincidence of \gls{snb}  triggers collected from participating experiments

sno.defHTML:
The Sudbury Neutrino Observatory was a detector built 6800 feet under
ground, in INCO’s Creighton mine near Sudbury, Ontario, Canada. SNO was
a heavy-water Cherenkov detector designed to detect neutrinos produced
by fusion reactions in the sun.
sno.defLaTeX: The Sudbury Neutrino Observatory was a detector built 6800 feet under ground, in INCO's Creighton mine near Sudbury, Ontario, Canada. SNO was a heavy-water Cherenkov detector designed to detect neutrinos produced by fusion reactions in the sun

snowglobes.defHTML: From the official description: SNOwGLoBES is public software for computing interaction rates and distributions of observed quantities for SNB neutrinos in common detector materials.
snowglobes.defLaTeX: From the official description: SNOwGLoBES is public software for computing interaction rates and distributions of observed quantities for \gls{snb} neutrinos in common detector materials

sof.defHTML:
a technology in which a fiber optic cable carries detector output
that has been converted from an electrical to an optical pulse.
sof.defLaTeX: a technology in which a fiber optic cable carries detector output that has been converted from an electrical to an optical pulse

solarization.defHTML:
Aging caused by exposure to UV-light, which can lead to increased
attenuation.
solarization.defLaTeX: Aging caused by exposure to UV-light, which can lead to increased attenuation

sonic.defHTML: Framework for implementing machine learning algorithms on co-processors developed by Fermilab.
sonic.defLaTeX: Framework for implementing machine learning algorithms on co-processors developed by \gls{fnal}
sonic.term: Services for OptimizedNetwork Inference on Coprocessors
sonic.termHTML: Services for OptimizedNetwork Inference on Coprocessors

sp.defHTML: Distinguishes a LArTPC technology by the fact that it operates using argon in its liquid phase only; a legacy DUNE term now replaced by horizontal drift and vertical drift.
sp.defLaTeX: Distinguishes a \gls{lartpc} technology by the fact that it operates using argon in its liquid phase only; a legacy \gls{dune} term now replaced by \gls{hd} and \gls{vd}

spack.defHTML: Software package manager for UNIX and mac OS systems.
spack.defLaTeX: Software package manager for UNIX and mac OS systems

sphd.defHTML: LArTPC design in which electrons drift horizontally to wire plane anodes (APAs) that along with the front-end electronics are immersed in LAr.
sphd.defLaTeX: LArTPC design in which electrons drift horizontally to wire plane anodes (\glspl{apa}) that along with the front-end electronics are immersed in LAr

spi.defHTML:
The Serial Peripheral Interface is asynchronous serial communication
interface specification used for short distancecommunication, primarily
in embedded systems.
spi.defLaTeX: The Serial Peripheral Interface is asynchronous serial communication interface specification used for short distancecommunication, primarily in embedded systems

spice.defHTML:
a general-purpose,open-source analog electronic circuit simulator. It
is a program used in integratedcircuit and board-level design to check
the integrity of circuit designs and topredict circuit behavior.
spice.defLaTeX: a general-purpose,open-source analog electronic circuit simulator. It is a program used in integratedcircuit and board-level design to check the integrity of circuit designs and topredict circuit behavior
spice.term: Simulation Program with Integrated Circuit Emphasis
spice.termHTML: Simulation Program with Integrated Circuit Emphasis

spine.defHTML:
a machine-learning-based package designed for reconstructing data
from particle imaging detectors, specifically LArTPCs. It utilizes Deep
Neural Networks to process and analyze detector data, with Convolutional
Neural Networks extracting pixel-level features and Graph Neural
Networks forming larger structures like particle tracks and showers.
spine.defLaTeX: a machine-learning-based package designed for reconstructing data from particle imaging detectors, specifically LArTPCs. It utilizes Deep Neural Networks to process and analyze detector data, with Convolutional Neural Networks extracting pixel-level features and Graph Neural Networks forming larger structures like particle tracks and showers
spine.term: Scalable Particle Imaging with Neural Embeddings
spine.termHTML: Scalable Particle Imaging with Neural Embeddings

spvd.defHTML:
LArTPC design in which electrons drift vertically to PCB-based anodes
at the top and bottom of the LAr volume, with a cathode in the
middle.
spvd.defLaTeX: LArTPC design in which electrons drift vertically to PCB-based anodes at the top and bottom of the LAr volume,  with a cathode in the middle

ssc.defHTML:
The Superconducting Super Collider was to be a huge underground ring
complex beneath the area near Waxahachie, Texas, USA, that would have
been the world’s most energetic particle accelerator. It was begun in
1990, but canceled by the U.S. Congress in 1993 (scientificamerican.com
Oct 2013).
ssc.defLaTeX: The Superconducting Super Collider was to be a huge underground ring complex beneath the area near Waxahachie, Texas, USA, that would have been the world’s most energetic particle accelerator. It was begun in 1990, but canceled by the U.S. Congress in 1993 (scientificamerican.com Oct 2013)

ssd.defHTML: Any storage device that may provide sufficient write throughput to receive, both collectively and distributed, the sustained full rate of data from a far detector module for many seconds.
ssd.defLaTeX: Any storage device that  may provide sufficient write throughput to receive, both collectively and  distributed, the sustained full rate of data from a \gls{detmodule}  for many seconds

sso.defHTML: Used at Fermilab to indicate that a group of services, such as DocDB or the DUNE Wiki share common sign-in credentials and active sessions. Fermilab services that say "Sign in with SSO username and password" mean to use your Fermilab Services or federated username and password.
sso.defLaTeX: Used at \gls{fnal} to indicate that a group of services,  such as DocDB or the DUNE Wiki share common sign-in credentials and active sessions.  \gls{fnal}  services that say "Sign in with SSO username and password" mean to use your \gls{fnal} Services or federated username and password

stashcache.defHTML:
A distributed caching federation that enables opportunistic users to
utilize nearby opportunistic storage.
stashcache.defLaTeX: A distributed caching federation that enables opportunistic users to utilize nearby opportunistic storage

stv.defHTML:
Kinematical variables obtained by projecting the neutrino interaction
onto the transverse plane.
stv.defLaTeX: Kinematical variables obtained by projecting the neutrino interaction onto the transverse plane

surf.defHTML: The laboratory in Lead, SD, USA where the DUNE FD will be installed and operated; also where the LBNF/DUNE-US FSCF and the FS cryostat and cryogenics systems will be constructed.
surf.defLaTeX: The laboratory in Lead, SD, USA where the \gls{dune} \gls{fd} will be installed and operated; also where the \gls{usproj} \gls{fscf} and the \gls{fs} cryostat and cryogenics systems will be constructed

susy.defHTML: Theoretical symmetry between a fermion and a boson.
susy.defLaTeX: Theoretical symmetry between a fermion and a boson

t2k.defHTML:
T2K (Tokai to Kamioka) is a long-baseline neutrino experiment in
Japan studying neutrino oscillations.
t2k.defLaTeX: T2K (Tokai to Kamioka) is a long-baseline neutrino experiment in Japan studying neutrino oscillations

tallbo.defHTML: A cylindrical cryostat at Fermilab primarily used for developing scintillation light collection technologies for LArTPC detectors.
tallbo.defLaTeX: A cylindrical cryostat at \gls{fnal} primarily used for developing scintillation light collection technologies for \gls{lartpc} detectors

tap.defHTML: A document required for any trip by a worker to the underground area at SURF, per that site’s access control program; it describes the work to be accomplished during the trip.
tap.defLaTeX: A document required for any trip by a worker to the underground area at \gls{surf}, per that site's access control program; it describes the work to be accomplished during the trip

tb.defHTML:
The DUNE organization responsible for evaluating technical
decisions.
tb.defLaTeX: The DUNE organization responsible for  evaluating technical decisions

tc.defHTML: The DUNE organization responsible for overall integration of the detector elements and successful execution of the detector construction project; areas of responsibility include general project oversight, systems engineering, QA and safety.
tc.defLaTeX: The DUNE organization responsible for overall integration of the detector elements and successful execution of the detector construction project; areas of responsibility include general project oversight, systems engineering, \gls{qa} and safety

tcm.defHTML: A message flowing down the trigger hierarchy from global to local context. Also see TPM.
tcm.defLaTeX: A message flowing  down the trigger hierarchy from global to local context.  Also see \gls{tpm}

tco.defHTML:
An opening in the side of a cryostat through which detector elements
are brought into the cryostat; utilized during construction and
installation.
tco.defLaTeX: An opening in the side of a cryostat through which detector elements are brought into the cryostat; utilized during construction and installation

tcoord.defLaTeX: A member of the \gls{dune} management team responsible for organizing the technical aspects of the project effort; is head of \gls{tc}

tde.defHTML:
top detector electronics in a vertical drift DUNE far detector
module.
tde.defLaTeX: top detector electronics in a vertical drift DUNE far detector module

tdr.defHTML:
Depending on context, either "technical design report," a formal
project document that describes the experiment at a technical level, or
"technical design review," a formal review of the technical design of
the experiment or of a component.
tdr.defLaTeX: Depending on context, either ``technical design report,'' a formal project  document  that describes the experiment at a technical level, or ``technical design review,'' a formal review of the technical design of the experiment or of a component

thd.defHTML: Total harmonic distortion is the ratio of the RMS value of the fundamental signal to the mean value of the root-sum-square of its harmonics.
thd.defLaTeX: Total harmonic distortion is the ratio of the \gls{rms} value of the fundamental signal to the mean value of the root-sum-square of its harmonics

tki.defHTML:
The imbalance among final-state particle momenta in the transverse
plane to the neutrino direction; different aspects of the imbalance are
sensitive to the detail of the nuclear effects in neutrino-nucleus
interactions.
tki.defLaTeX: The imbalance among final-state particle momenta in the transverse plane to the neutrino direction; different aspects of the imbalance are sensitive to the detail of the nuclear effects in neutrino-nucleus interactions

tms.defHTML: A muon spectrometer for the Near Detector that will be installed for the initial running period of DUNE, before the MPD detector component is ready.
tms.defLaTeX: A muon spectrometer for the Near Detector that will be installed for the initial running period of DUNE, before the \gls{mpd} detector component is ready

toad.defHTML: A test of a high-pressure gaseous argon TPC in the Fermilab Test Beam Facility FTBF.
toad.defLaTeX: A test of a high-pressure gaseous argon TPC in the Fermilab Test Beam Facility \gls{ftbf}
toad.term: Teststand of an Overpressure Argon Detector
toad.termHTML: Teststand of an Overpressure Argon Detector

tof.defHTML:
The time a particle takes to fly between two visible interactions
observed in the detector. If combined with the distance traveled by the
particle, for example a neutron, it can be used for energy
reconstruction.
tof.defLaTeX: The time a particle takes to fly between two visible interactions observed in the detector. If combined with the distance traveled by the particle, for example a neutron, it can be used for energy reconstruction

topfc.defHTML: The horizontal portions of the FD-HD field cage on the top of the TPC.
topfc.defLaTeX: The horizontal portions of the \gls{sphd} \gls{fc}   on the top of the \gls{tpc}

tp.defHTML: An intermediatemilestone on the path to a full TDR.
tp.defLaTeX: An intermediatemilestone on the path to a full \gls{tdr}

tpc.defHTML: Depending on context: (1) A type of particle detector that uses an E field together with a sensitive volume of gas or liquid, e.g., LAr, to perform a 3D reconstruction of a particle trajectory or interaction. The activity is recorded by digitizing the waveforms of current induced on the anode as the distribution of ionization charge passes by or is collected on the electrode. (2) TPC is also used in LBNF/DUNE-US for "total project cost".
tpc.defLaTeX: Depending on context: (1) A type of particle detector that uses an \efield together with a sensitive volume of gas or liquid, e.g., \gls{lar}, to perform a \threed reconstruction of a particle trajectory or interaction. The activity is recorded by digitizing the waveforms of current  induced on the anode as the distribution of ionization charge passes by  or is collected on the electrode. (2) TPC is also used in \gls{usproj} for ``total project cost''

tpcost.defHTML: The DOE terminology for the total budget and contingency for the entire LBNF/DUNE-US project from CD-0 to CD-4.
tpcost.defLaTeX: The DOE terminology for the total budget and contingency for the entire \gls{usproj} project from CD-0 to CD-4

tpm.defHTML: A message flowing up the trigger hierarchy from local to global context. Also see TCM.
tpm.defLaTeX: A message flowing  up the trigger hierarchy from local to global context.  Also see \gls{tcm}

tr.defHTML: A data record produced by the DUNE DAQ system. A Trigger Record can contain multiple interaction "events" or none.
tr.defLaTeX: A data record produced by the \gls{dune} \gls{daq} system.  A Trigger Record can contain multiple interaction ``events'' or none

trigact.defHTML: a correlation (or cluster) in time and space within a stream of trigger primitives.
trigact.defLaTeX: a correlation (or cluster) in time and space within a stream of \glspl{trigprimitive}

trigcandidate.defHTML: Summary information derived from the full data stream and representing a contribution toward forming a trigger decision.
trigcandidate.defLaTeX: Summary information derived  from the full data stream and representing a contribution toward  forming a \gls{trigdecision}

trigcommand.defHTML: Information derived from one or more trigger candidates that directs elements of a far detector module to read out a portion of the data stream.
trigcommand.defLaTeX: Information derived from  one or more \glspl{trigcandidate}  that directs elements of a  \gls{detmodule} to read out a portion of the data stream

trigdecision.defHTML: The process by which trigger candidates are converted into trigger commands.
trigdecision.defLaTeX: The process by which  \glspl{trigcandidate} are converted into \glspl{trigcommand}

trignote.defHTML: Information provided by MTL to ETL about trigger decision processing.
trignote.defLaTeX: Information provided by  \gls{mtl} to \gls{etl} about \gls{trigdecision}  processing

trigprimitive.defHTML: Information derived by the DAQ FE hardware that describes a region of space (e.g., one or several neighboring channels) and time (e.g., a contiguous set of ADC sample ticks) associated with some activity.
trigprimitive.defLaTeX: Information derived by  the \gls{daq} \gls{fe} hardware that describes a region of space (e.g.,  one or several neighboring channels) and time (e.g., a contiguous set  of \gls{adc} sample ticks) associated with some activity

trigrec.defHTML:
a collection of data and metadata from selected detector space-time
volumes corresponding to a trigger decision.
trigrec.defLaTeX: a collection of data and metadata from selected detector space-time volumes corresponding to a trigger decision

tti.defHTML: Power supply that powers the SiPMs in the Light readout.
tti.defLaTeX: Power supply that powers the SiPMs in the Light readout

ua1.defHTML: UA1 (Underground Area 1) was a particle detector at CERN’s Super Proton Synchrotron (SPS). It ran from 1981 until 1990, when the SPS was used as a proton-antiproton collider, searching for traces of W and Z particles in collisions. (CERN) The UA1 dipole magnet was reused in the NOMAD experiment and currently provides the magnetic field for the T2K ND280 detector.
ua1.defLaTeX: UA1 (Underground Area 1) was a particle detector at \gls{cern}'s  Super Proton Synchrotron (SPS). It ran from 1981 until 1990, when the SPS was used as a proton-antiproton collider, searching for traces of W and Z particles in collisions. (CERN) The UA1 dipole magnet was reused in the NOMAD experiment and currently provides the magnetic field for the \gls{t2k} ND280 detector

uart.defHTML:
A universalasynchronous receiver-transmitter is a computer hardware
device for asynchronousserial communication in which the data format and
transmission speeds are configurable.
uart.defLaTeX: A universalasynchronous receiver-transmitter is a computer hardware device for asynchronousserial communication in which the data format and transmission speeds are configurable

ucondb.defHTML: Unstructured conditions database developed for Fermilab fixed target experiments.
ucondb.defLaTeX: Unstructured conditions database developed for \gls{fnal} fixed target experiments

udp.defHTML:
A simple, connectionless Internet protocol that supports data
integrity checksums, requires no handshaking, and does not guarantee
packet delivery.
udp.defLaTeX: A simple,  connectionless Internet protocol that supports data integrity  checksums, requires no handshaking, and does not guarantee packet delivery

ufer.defHTML:
U.S. National Electrical Code grounding method refered to as Concrete
Encased Electrode.
ufer.defLaTeX: U.S. National Electrical Code grounding method refered to as Concrete Encased Electrode

uit.defHTML: An organizational unit responsible for installation in the underground area at the SURF site.
uit.defLaTeX: An organizational unit responsible for installation in the underground area at the \gls{surf} site

unicamp.defHTML: University of Campinas, Sao Paulo, Brazil.
unicamp.defLaTeX: University of Campinas, Sao Paulo, Brazil

upd.defHTML:
A tool for uploading and downloading pre-built software products
between local systems and centralized software distribution servers. UPD
is not frequently used on DUNE because newer tools are more
convenient.
upd.defLaTeX: A tool for uploading and downloading pre-built software products between local systems and centralized software distribution servers.  UPD is not frequently used on DUNE because newer tools are more convenient

ups.defHTML:
A software tool that sets up a consistent environment of versions of
pre-installed products and their dependencies on UNIX-like platforms.
ups.defLaTeX: A software tool that sets up a consistent environment of versions of pre-installed products and their dependencies on UNIX-like platforms

usproj.defHTML: Long-Baseline Neutrino Facility/Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment - United States; project to design and build the conventional and beamline facilities and the DOE contributions to the detectors. It is organized as a DOE/Fermilab project and incorporates contributions to the facilities from international partners. It also acts as host for the installation and integration of the DUNE detectors.
usproj.defLaTeX: Long-Baseline Neutrino Facility/Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment - United States; project to design and build the conventional and beamline facilities and the \gls{doe} contributions to the detectors. It is organized as a \gls{doe}/\gls{fnal} project and incorporates contributions to the facilities from international partners. It also acts as host for the installation and integration of the DUNE detectors

utca.defHTML: The computer architecture specification followed by the crates that house charge and light readout electronics; used in the FD-VD and DP technologies.
utca.defLaTeX: The computer architecture specification followed by the crates that house charge and light readout electronics; used in the \gls{spvd} and \gls{dp} technologies

uvm.defHTML:
The Universal Verification Methodology is a standardized methodology
for verifying integrated circuit designs.
uvm.defLaTeX: The Universal Verification Methodology is a standardized methodology for verifying integrated circuit designs

valor.defHTML: A neutrino oscillation fitting framework that is used by T2K; the name stands for VALencia-Oxford-Rutherford, the original three institutions that developed it.
valor.defLaTeX: A neutrino oscillation fitting framework that is used by \gls{t2k}; the name stands for VALencia-Oxford-Rutherford, the original three institutions that developed it

vdmod0.defHTML: The final pre-production ProtoDUNE instance for the DUNE FD-VD far detector module, it will use the 800 t cryostat in NP02.
vdmod0.defLaTeX: The final pre-production \gls{protodune} instance for the DUNE \gls{spvd} \gls{detmodule},  it will use the 800\,t cryostat in \gls{np02}

vm.defHTML:
Emulator of a physical computer that allows multiple users to
configure different operating systems while sharing physical
hardware.
vm.defLaTeX: Emulator of a physical computer that allows multiple users to configure different operating systems  while sharing physical hardware

vo.defHTML:
A database containing a list of member names, certificate
distinguishing information, and a list of permissions members have to
access computing grid and data resources.
vo.defLaTeX: A database containing a list of member names, certificate distinguishing information, and a list of permissions members have to access computing grid and data resources

voms.defHTML: Virtual Organization Membership Service (in grid computing).
voms.defLaTeX: Virtual Organization Membership Service (in grid computing)

vrf.defHTML:
Networking overlays that provide a logical routing infrastructure
that allows flexible traffic engineering.
vrf.defLaTeX: Networking overlays that provide  a logical routing infrastructure  that allows flexible traffic engineering

wa105.defHTML: The3m×1m×1m WA105 DP prototype detector at CERN.

wan.defHTML: Computing network that interconnects LANs across relatively broad geographic areas.
wan.defLaTeX: Computing network that interconnects \glspl{lan} across relatively broad geographic areas

wbs.defHTML:
An organizational project management tool by which the tasks to be
performed are partitioned in a hierarchical manner.
wbs.defLaTeX: An organizational  project management tool by which the tasks to be performed are  partitioned in a hierarchical manner

wct.defHTML: A software toolkit with data flow processing components for LArTPC noise and signal simulation, noise filtering, signal processing, and tomographic 3D ionization activity imaging.
wct.defLaTeX: A software toolkit with data flow processing components for \gls{lartpc} noise and signal simulation, noise filtering, signal processing, and tomographic \threed ionization activity imaging

wg.defHTML: A group of persons working together to achieve specified goals.
wg.defLaTeX: A group of persons working together to achieve specified goals

wib.defHTML: Digital electronics situated just outside a FD cryostat that receives digital data from the FEMBs (part of CE) over cold copper connections and sends it to the RCE FE readout hardware.
wib.defLaTeX: Digital electronics  situated just outside a FD cryostat that receives digital data  from the \glspl{femb} (part of \gls{ce}) over cold copper connections and sends it to the \gls{rce}  \gls{fe} readout hardware

wiec.defHTML: Crates mounted on the signal flanges that contain the WIBs.
wiec.defLaTeX: Crates mounted on the signal flanges that contain the \glspl{wib}

wimp.defHTML: A hypothesized particle that may be a component of dark matter.
wimp.defLaTeX: A  hypothesized particle that may be a component of dark matter

winze.defHTML: A vertical excavation at SURF connecting two drifts, not connecting to the surface.
winze.defLaTeX: A vertical excavation at \gls{surf} connecting two drifts, not connecting to the surface

wire board.defHTML: At the head end of the APA in the FD-HD TPC, stacks of electronics boards referred to as "wire boards" are arrayed to anchor the wires. They also provide the connection between the wires and the cold electronics.
wire board.defLaTeX: At the head end of the APA in the \gls{sphd} \gls{tpc}, stacks of electronics boards referred to as ``wire boards'' are arrayed to anchor the wires.  They also provide the connection between the wires and the cold electronics

wirecell.defHTML: A tomographic automated 3D neutrino event reconstruction method for LArTPCs.
wirecell.defLaTeX: A tomographic automated \threed neutrino event reconstruction method for \glspl{lartpc}

wls.defHTML:
A material or process by which incident photons are absorbed by a
material and photons are emitted at a different, typically longer,
wavelength.
wls.defLaTeX: A material or process by  which incident photons are absorbed by a material and photons are  emitted at a different, typically longer, wavelength

wms.defHTML:
Commercial software package used to track shipments and interface to
freight forwarders. This includes a database for shipping.
wms.defLaTeX: Commercial software package used to track shipments and interface to freight forwarders. This includes a database for shipping

wr.defHTML:
A component of the timing system that forwards clock signal and
time-of-day reference data to the master timing unit.
wr.defLaTeX: A component of the timing system that forwards clock signal and time-of-day reference data to the master timing unit

wrmch.defHTML: A card mounted in μTCA crate that recieves time syncronization information and trigger data packets over WR network and disributes them to the AMC over μTCA backplane.
wrmch.defLaTeX: A card mounted in \gls{utca} crate that recieves time syncronization information and trigger data packets over \gls{wr} network and disributes them to the \gls{amc} over \gls{utca} backplane
wrmch.termHTML: White Rabbit μTCA Carrier Hub

wrtsn.defHTML: A unit on the WR network that timestamps the trigger signals and sends out trigger data packets to WR-MCH.
wrtsn.defLaTeX: A unit on the \gls{wr} network that timestamps the trigger signals and sends out trigger data packets to \gls{wrmch}

xarapu.defHTML: Extended ARAPUCA design with WLS coating on only the external face of the dichroic filter window(s) but with a WLS doped plate inside the cell.
xarapu.defLaTeX: Extended \gls{arapuca} design with \gls{wls} coating on only the external face of the dichroic filter window(s) but with a \gls{wls} doped plate inside the cell

xml.defHTML:
A markup language that defines a set of rules for encoding documents
in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable.
xml.defLaTeX: A markup language that defines a set of rules for encoding documents in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable

xrootd.defHTML: a high-performance data system widely used in HEP to store and to distribute data to jobs. It allows streaming of data.
xrootd.defLaTeX: a high-performance data system widely used in \gls{hep} to store and to distribute data to jobs.  It allows streaming of data

zs.defHTML: Used to delete some portion of a data stream that does not significantly deviate from zero or intrinsic noise levels. It may be applied at different granularity from per-channel to per detector unit.
zs.defLaTeX: Used to delete some portion of a  data stream that does not significantly deviate from zero or  intrinsic noise levels.  It may be applied at different granularity from per-channel to per  \gls{detunit}
